Dash Menu
Dash Menu
Login
Seated Mode

ü°Ñ Press <color=#8888ff>button</color> to <color=#8888ff>highlight</color> part of the <color=#8888ff>Dash Menu</color>.
This <color=#8888ff>highlights</color> the <color=#fffe88>controller layout facet</color>, showing how to open your <color=#8888ff>Dash Menu</color>.

The <color=#8888ff>Dash Menu</color> is your control center for <color=#8888ff>NeosVR</color>, through it you can:
 - Spawn items and avatars
 - Talk with friends
 - Anything, custom <color=#8888ff>facets</color> can be added
Your own <color=#8888ff>Dash Menu</color> is visible only to you.
<color=#ffb888>Clicking on the wall-mural <color=#8888ff>Dash Menus</color> will not do anything, use your own.</color>

<color=#8888ff>You are logged in:</color> No action is needed!
The rest of this is to help those who are not logged in.
<color=#ff8888>You are not logged in:</color> You can use <color=#ff8888>NeosVR</color> without an account, but there are certain restrictions.

Users who are not logged in cannot:
	 - Add items to their inventory
 - Friend other users
 - Set a default avatar
To login or create an account in VR click the Login/Register button in the Dash Menu.

Click to
Register Online
<color=#fffe88>Seated Mode</color> temporarily shifts you <color=#8888ff>up</color> so your head is at <color=#8888ff>standing height</color>.

Audio and Settings
Mic Mode
Noise Gate
The <color=#fffe88>mic modes</color> affect how others <color=#8888ff>hear</color> you.
In mute nobody can hear you, it is a toggle.

<color=#fffe88>Whisper</color> spawns a <color=#8888ff>bubble</color> around you, only those <color=#8888ff>inside</color> the <color=#8888ff>bubble</color> can <color=#8888ff>hear you</color>, <color=#ffb888>this does not affect their voice.</color>
<color=#fffe88>Normal</color> is the standard <color=#8888ff>volume</color> and <color=#8888ff>distance falloff</color>.
<color=#fffe88>Shout</color> is like <color=#8888ff>normal</color>-plus, your <color=#8888ff>distance falloff</color> is <color=#8888ff>linear</color> instead of <color=#8888ff>logarithmic</color>.
In <color=#fffe88>broadcast</color> everyone hears you <color=#8888ff>without specialization</color>, distance does not matter. <color=#ffb888>People do not enjoy this, use with caution.</color>

Your <color=#8888ff>noise gate</color> is displayed in the <color=#fffe88>volume meter</color> as the vertical bar. The <color=#8888ff>noise gate</color> prevents you from <color=#8888ff>broadcasting</color> due to <color=#8888ff>background noise</color>, such as a fan.

When the <color=#8888ff>lower bar</color> in the <color=#8888ff>volume meter</color> passes the <color=#8888ff>noise gate</color>, the <color=#8888ff>microphone</color> is <color=#8888ff>broadcasting</color>. This is shown by the <color=#8888ff>upper bar moving</color>, the bar may not fill completly, but your voice is being transmitted.

While watching the <color=#8888ff>volume meter</color>, update your <color=#fffe88>noise gate setting</color> until the <color=#8888ff>upper bar</color> is empty when you <color=#8888ff>are not speaking</color>, and <color=#8888ff>moving</color> when you <color=#8888ff>are speaking</color>.
<color=#ffb888>NOTE: If you are <color=#8888ff>muted</color> the bar will not move. See <color=#8888ff>Mic Modes</color> to for how to <color=#8888ff>un-mute</color> yourself.

messages.User Made Tutorial World.Exit Message:
Congrats! You've made it to the end.
Double Tap a world orb to hop into a world
(Pink worlds have people in them, purple none)
AND WELCOME TO NEOS!

messages.User Made Tutorial World.Tools Room.Tool: <color=#8888ff>Tools</color> are a kind of <color=#8888ff>asset</color> that is <color=#8888ff>equippable</color>!
There are several different <color=#8888ff>tools</color> used for building and modifying worlds. Others may be used as weapons or fun gadgets.
The <color=#8888ff>tool</color> shaped like a cone in front of you deletes the <color=#ff8888>shapes</color> holding the door closed.
messages.User Made Tutorial World.Tools Room.Equi:
You can grip a tool to temp-equip the tool.
When you let go of the tool it is dropped.

You can switch between <color=#8888ff>temp-equip</color> and <color=#8888ff>sticky</color> using the <color=#ff44ff>context menu</color> options <color=#8888ee>sticky-equip</color> and <color=#8888ff>dequip</color>.
messages.User Made Tutorial World.Tools Room.Prim: <color=#8888ff>Tools</color> tend to use two actions, <color=#8888ff>primary</color> and <color=#88ff88>secondary</color>. Up until now you have probably only used <color=#8888ff>primary</color>, but to beat this room you must also use <color=#88ff88>secondary</color>!
A <color=#8888ff>tool</color> can build their own <color=#8888ff>actions</color> as well, I know of a few that use <color=#8888ff>position</color> or <color=#8888ff>rotation</color> as actions.
For this <color=#8888ff>cone</color>, only <color=#8888ff>primary</color> and <color=#88ff88>secondary</color> do things.

Hold the tool with grip and point it at the shapes over the exit door.

Aiming at each shape in turn, press primary on the blue cubes and secondary on the green spheres.
messages.User Made Tutorial World.Tools Room.Tool: <color=#8888ff>Tools</color> can be stored there by <color=#8888ff>pointing</color> the <color=#8888ff>tool</color> at the <color=#8888ff>toolshelf</color> and pulling the <color=#8888ff>trigger</color>.

Aiming at a <color=#8888ff>tool</color> already on the <color=#8888ff>toolshelf</color> and pulling the trigger <color=#8888ff>equips</color> the <color=#8888ff>tool</color>. If you already have a <color=#8888ff>tool equipped</color>, the <color=#8888ff>tools</color> will be <color=#8888ff>swapped</color> instead.
